intro: Tugarinovia mongolica, commonly known as the Mongolian bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the steppes of Mongolia and adjacent regions. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its blue to violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the harsh climate of its native habitat. Tugarinovia mongolica is often found in open grasslands and is a valuable component of the local flora.
